titles.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 3195) to restore the intent and protections of the Americans with Disabilities Act of 1990.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 110-733, by Ms. Sutton.

All points of order against consideration of the bill are waived except those arising under clause 9 or 10 of rule XXI. The amendment in the nature of a substitute recommended by the Committee on Education and Labor now printed in the bill shall be considered as adopted.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 243.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 1299.

POSTPONED PROCEEDINGS - At the conclusion of debate on H. Res. 1299, the Chair put the question on ordering the previous question and by voice vote, announced that the ayes had prevailed. Mr. Sessions demanded the yeas and nays and the Chair postponed further proceedings on the question until a time to be announced.
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 221 - 194 (Roll no. 453).

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

term.name: Civil rights and liberties, minority issues

bill.summary: 6/24/2008--Introduced. Sets forth the rule for consideration of the bill (H.R. 3195) to restore the intent and protections of the Americans with Disabilities Act of 1990.
